formalpara.title: Summary
formalpara.para: The oVirt Node (v.6 x86_64) Red Hat Network channel contains the Node packages. the Node itself is contained in the rhev-hypervisor6 package. Additional tools supporting USB and PXE installations are contained in the rhev-hypervisor-tools package. You must install the Node packages on the system that you intend to use to create Node boot media.

step.title: Subscribing to download the Node using RHN Classic

step.para: Log on to Red Hat Network ().
Move the mouse cursor over the Subscriptions link at the top of the page, and then click Registered Systems in the menu that appears.
Select the system to which you are adding channels from the list presented on the screen, by clicking the name of the system.
Click Alter Channel Subscriptions in the Subscribed Channels section of the screen.
Select the oVirt Node (v.6 x86_64) channel from the list presented on the screen, then click the Change Subscription button to finalize the change.

note.para: Beta releases of oVirt Node are distributed using an alternative channel. Beta releases consist of pre-release software. They must not be used in a production environment. The entitlement required to obtain beta releases of the oVirt Node is called oVirt Node Beta (v.6 x86_64).

step.para: Log in to the system on which the oVirt Engine is installed. You must log in as the root user.
Use yum to install the rhev-hypervisor6 and rhev-hypervisor-tools packages.

formalpara.title: Result
formalpara.para: the Node ISO image is installed into the /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/ directory. The rhevh-iso-to-disk and rhevh-iso-to-pxeboot scripts are installed to the /usr/bin directory.

note.para: Fedora 6.2 and later allows more than one version of the ISO image to be installed at one time. As such, /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/rhev-hypervisor.iso is now a symbolic link to a uniquely-named version of the Node ISO image, such as /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/rhevh-6.2-20111006.0.el6.iso. Different versions of the image can now be installed alongside each other, allowing administrators to run and maintain a cluster on a previous version of the Node while upgrading another cluster for testing.

Additionally, the symbolic links /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/rhevh-latest6.iso, and /usr/share/rhev-hypervisor/rhev-hypervisor6.iso are created. These links also target the most recently installed version of the oVirt ISO image.
